Give me the even six, then.
DRAPER
Six yards and no scrimping. (PIERRE
CHEATS A LITTLE BY PULLING THE CLOTH
TOWARD HIM) One-take hold there-
and two-and three-and four-
and five——and six?
PIERRE
(SERIOUSLY) Measured close?
DRAPER
Shall I measure back again? (TURNS
HIS MEASURE IN OPPOSITE DIRECTION)
PIERRE
(SUDDENLY CHEERFUL) Oh, dear no?
There’s always a little gain or loss
to someone.
DRAPER
M(z)to os D Now, let’s see./(CUTS CLOTH) At four
and twenty pence, each, for the six
yards, that’s seven francs, & sous.
But, for the friend of my father-
we’ll call it seven francs.
PIERRE
Seven francs?
DRAPER
Yes.
